medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain onset was at 4 AM yesterday and persisted, with radiation to the back. The patient was able to drink water last yesterday but has not since, and denies chest pain, shortness of breath, fever, chills, dysuria, hematuria, or diarrhea. She returned to the emergency department after the pain persisted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anxiety, fibromyalgia, possible G6PD deficiency, and open hysterectomy years ago.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had gallbladder surgery; denies any bleeding problems.
